protocol_name: High molecular weight DNA extraction after Bolger et al.
protocol_name_html: High molecular weight DNA extraction after Bolger et al.
description:
Extraction of high molecular weight DNA after Bolger et al.  

 

Carried out for eucalyptus grandis. 

DNA fragments were ranging up to 270 kb on a Pulsfield Electrophoresis Gel

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

guidelines:
Modified from Section 1.3 of Supplementary materials from Anthony Bolger et al., The genome of the stress-tolerant wild tomato species Solanum pennellii, Nature genetics, Vol 46,1034-1038 (2014)  doi:10.1038/ng.3046

 

Link: http://www.nature.com/ng/journal/v46/n9/full/ng.3046.html#supplementary

 

When citing please make sure to mention the original Bolger et al. protocol as described above. 

 

Thank you very much Benjamin Schwessinger and Jasmine Saban for carrying out the extraction with me. 

 

Reagents required: 

 

Extraction Buffer (pH 6.0):

1 M 2-methyl-2,4-pentanediol 

 

10 mM PIPES (1,4-Piperazinediethanesulfonic acid sodium salt)

10 mM MgCl2

4% (w/v) PVP-10

10 mM sodium metabisulfite

25 mM 2-mercaptoethanol

0.5% (w/v) sodium diethyldithiocarbamate

200 mM L-lysine

6 mM ethylene glycol tetraacetic acid (EGTA), 

 

Nuclear Buffer (pH 7.0):

0.5 M 2-methly-2,4-pentanediol

10 mM PIPES

10 mM MgCl2

0.5% (v/v) Triton X-100

10 mM sodium metabisulfite

60 mM 2-mercaptoethanol

200 mM L-lysine

6 mM EGTA, pH 7.

 

TE Buffer (pH 7.0): 

10 mM Tris

1 mM EDTA

 

Others solutions: 

Triton X-100

20% (w/v) SDS (Sodium dodecyl sulfate)

5 M sodium perchlorate

Phenol/Chloroform/Isoamylalcohol (25:24:1)

Chloroform/Isoamylalcohol (24:1)

100% Ethanol

70% Ethanol (fresh)

TE buffer

components.data: Prepare extraction buffer, nuclear buffer and TE buffer to cool it down to 4 °C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare extraction buffer, nuclear buffer and TE buffer to cool it down to 4 °C

components.data: Harvest 50 g of young leaves into 1 L ice cold TE buffer (pH 7)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest 50 g of young leaves into 1 L ice cold TE buffer (pH 7)

components.data:
Transfer leaves into pre-chilled Waring blender and add 600 mL lysis buffer 

 

*steps 3-6 were carried out in 4 °C temperature room
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer leaves into pre-chilled Waring blender and add 600 mL lysis buffer 

 

*steps 3-6 were carried out in 4 °C temperature room

components.data:
Homogenise in 15 s bursts for a total of 1 min and 15 s  

 

 (homogenising times may vary due to plant material, shorter times could lead to more full nuclei but lower yield)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Homogenise in 15 s bursts for a total of 1 min and 15 s  

 

 (homogenising times may vary due to plant material, shorter times could lead to more full nuclei but lower yield)

components.data: Transfer plant material to Miracloth (filtrationmaterial for homogenates) and squeeze through 4 layers and further gravity filter through 8 layers of Miracloth
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer plant material to Miracloth (filtrationmaterial for homogenates) and squeeze through 4 layers and further gravity filter through 8 layers of Miracloth

components.data: Add 10% (v/v) Triton X-100 to the homogenate to a final concentration of 0.5% (v/v)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10% (v/v) Triton X-100 to the homogenate to a final concentration of 0.5% (v/v)

components.data: Incubate mixture on an ice bath with gentle rocking for 30 min
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate mixture on an ice bath with gentle rocking for 30 min
Centrifuge at 600 g and 4 °C for 20 minutes
Discard supernatant

components.data: Add sufficient nuclear buffer to bring the volume up to 10 mL
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add sufficient nuclear buffer to bring the volume up to 10 mL
Centrifuge at 600 g and 4 °C for 20 minutes

components.data: Repeat washing steps 9-12 twice more (until the pellet becomes grey-white and no traces of green are visible anymore)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat washing steps 9-12 twice more (until the pellet becomes grey-white and no traces of green are visible anymore)

components.data: Gently resuspend the pellet using a brush soaked in nuclear buffer and add sufficent nuclear buffer to bring volume up to 5 mL
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently resuspend the pellet using a brush soaked in nuclear buffer and add sufficent nuclear buffer to bring volume up to 5 mL

components.data: Gently resuspend the pellet using a normal painters brush (not used and optimaly sterilised before), soaked in freshly made pre-chilled nuclear buffer
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently resuspend the pellet using a normal painters brush (not used and optimaly sterilised before), soaked in freshly made pre-chilled nuclear buffer

components.data: Add 20% (w/v) SDS to a final concentration of 2% (w/v) (to lyse the nuclei) and gently invert the tube a few times
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 20% (w/v) SDS to a final concentration of 2% (w/v) (to lyse the nuclei) and gently invert the tube a few times

components.data: Incubate at 60 °C for 10 mins and then let cool down on bench to RT
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 60 °C for 10 mins and then let cool down on bench to RT

components.data: Add 5 M sodium perchlorate to a final concentration of 1 M
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 M sodium perchlorate to a final concentration of 1 M
Centrifuge at 400 g and 22 °C for 20 mins

components.data:
Gently remove supernatant to a new tube using a wide bore pipette tip

 

*use wide bore pipette tips for the rest of the protocol
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Gently remove supernatant to a new tube using a wide bore pipette tip

 

*use wide bore pipette tips for the rest of the protocol

components.data: Add an equal volume of phenol/chloroform/isoamylalcohol (25:24:1) to the tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of phenol/chloroform/isoamylalcohol (25:24:1) to the tube
Mix on a rotor for 10 mins

components.data: Centrifuge at 3000 g and 22 oC for 10 mins
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 3000 g and 22 oC for 10 mins

components.data: Transfer the upper phase to a new tube and discard lower phase
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the upper phase to a new tube and discard lower phase
Repeat steps 20-23

components.data: Repeat steps 20-23 twice more but only using chlorofom/isoamylalcohol (24:1)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps 20-23 twice more but only using chlorofom/isoamylalcohol (24:1)

components.data: Precipitate DNA by adding 2x volume of ice cold ethanol and gently invert several times
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate DNA by adding 2x volume of ice cold ethanol and gently invert several times

components.data: Transfer the precipitated DNA to a new tube using a tweezer or glass rod and wash once more with 10 mL 70 % (v/v) Ethanol
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the precipitated DNA to a new tube using a tweezer or glass rod and wash once more with 10 mL 70 % (v/v) Ethanol

components.data: Transfer the pellet to an 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube and allow the Ethanol to evaporate for approx. 5 mins (depends on the size of the pellet, but if the pellet dries out completely it might be difficult to dissolve the DNA again)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the pellet to an 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube and allow the Ethanol to evaporate for approx. 5 mins (depends on the size of the pellet, but if the pellet dries out completely it might be difficult to dissolve the DNA again)

components.data: Dissolve the DNA in TE buffer or nuclease free water, invert a few times and leave at RT over night for the DNA to dissolve completely
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dissolve the DNA in TE buffer or nuclease free water, invert a few times and leave at RT over night for the DNA to dissolve completely

components.data:
Meassure dsDNA concentration using Qubit and meassure absorbance using Nanodrop  

(because of the high concentration you might want to make e.g. 1:10 dilutions)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Meassure dsDNA concentration using Qubit and meassure absorbance using Nanodrop  

(because of the high concentration you might want to make e.g. 1:10 dilutions)

components.data: Run a 0.8 % TBE Agarose Gel with 200 ng dsDNA and lambda-Hind-III ladder as control.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run a 0.8 % TBE Agarose Gel with 200 ng dsDNA and lambda-Hind-III ladder as control.

components.data: If available run a Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis with 200 ng dsDNA and a MidRange PFG Marker II ladder as control.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If available run a Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis with 200 ng dsDNA and a MidRange PFG Marker II ladder as control.

components.data:
Nanodrop results:

 

 

Qubit to Nanodrop ratio: 0.7
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Nanodrop results:

 

 

Qubit to Nanodrop ratio: 0.7

components.data: 0.8 % TBE Agarose Gel with different amount of DNA but all from the same extraction above
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 0.8 % TBE Agarose Gel with different amount of DNA but all from the same extraction above

components.data:
Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis:

 

In order to determine the degeree of shearing of the DNA different vortexing times and pipetting times were tested: 

 

G1..original sample from extraction (maybe problems with the concentration here -->repeat the gel) 

v10..10 seconds vortexing

v20.. 20 s

v30.. 30 s 

v60.. 60 s

p5..  5 times pipetting up and down 

p10.. 10 times

p30.. 30 times

p60.. 60 times 

 

Conclusions: 

 

It looks like that at 267 kb there is a straight cut off due to the fact that the longer DNA couldn't enter the gel, also indicated by the red saturated bits still stuck in the pockets. 

As the amount of DNA between 24-48 kb seems to be increasing for bands 2-5, we think that with longer vortexing times more smaller and smaller fragments are produced. 

For bands 6-9 we think that fragmets are also sheared through pipetting but that there is a certain cut off due to the pipette tip size and what length of fragmetns fits through.

 

 

 *pipette tips were cut
components.name: Description

Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis:

 

In order to determine the degeree of shearing of the DNA different vortexing times and pipetting times were tested: 

 

G1..original sample from extraction (maybe problems with the concentration here -->repeat the gel) 

v10..10 seconds vortexing

v20.. 20 s

v30.. 30 s 

v60.. 60 s

p5..  5 times pipetting up and down 

p10.. 10 times

p30.. 30 times

p60.. 60 times 

 

Conclusions: 

 

It looks like that at 267 kb there is a straight cut off due to the fact that the longer DNA couldn't enter the gel, also indicated by the red saturated bits still stuck in the pockets. 

As the amount of DNA between 24-48 kb seems to be increasing for bands 2-5, we think that with longer vortexing times more smaller and smaller fragments are produced. 

For bands 6-9 we think that fragmets are also sheared through pipetting but that there is a certain cut off due to the pipette tip size and what length of fragmetns fits through.

 

 

 *pipette tips were cut
